title: Bed Bath & Beyond Has First Yearly Loss, Sales Decline as Public Company
summary: Home-goods retailer is caught in a proxy fight with a group of investors that wants to overhaul its board and replace its CEO. Bed Bath & Beyond Inc., under pressure to turn around operations, reported its first annual loss and sales decline in its nearly three decades as a public company.

title: Uber Aims for Valuation of as Much as $100 Billion, Below Expectations
summary: Ride-hailing company plans to price shares at between $48 and $55 apiece. Uber Technologies Inc. is aiming for a valuation in its impending initial public offering of as much as $100 billion, below previous expectations, as ride-hailing competitor Lyft Inc. stumbles in its early days of trading as a public company.

title: Investors Want Bed Bath & Beyond to Show a Turnaround
summary: Home-goods retailer has failed to keep up with rivals. When a trio of activist funds launched a proxy fight at Bed Bath & Beyond late last month, the stock surged 22%. Investors clearly were delighted by the prospect of change at the struggling home-goods retailer. The optimism may have been premature, though.

title: Fusion Connect Scrambles After Board Member's Investment Fizzles
summary: Cloud services company and its lenders hire advisers ahead of potential bankruptcy. Publicly traded cloud services provider Fusion Connect Inc. is scrambling to make up for the loss of up to $50 million in equity investments while consulting with restructuring advisers ahead of a potential bankruptcy, according to securities filings and people familiar with the matter.

title: Colleges in Admissions Scandal Zero In on What Students Knew
summary: Schools try to determine whether they were in on the scheme; affidavit suggests some were. Their parents have been indicted or pleaded guilty in connection with cheating to get them into college. Now what about the children?

title: Court-Ordered Caravan Deluge
summary: The anti-Trump 'resistance' includes judges making the border mess worse.. Did the chief justice of the U.S. Supreme Court contribute to the deluge of migrants at the nation's southern border? In December, John Roberts voted with the four liberal justices to sustain yet another national injunction that a district court judge imposed against the Trump administration's revision of the asylum laws.

title: After Floods, Snowy 'Bomb Cyclone' Moves In
summary: Plains, Upper Midwest brace for second big storm in two months; a strain for weakened infrastructure. The Great Plains and Upper Midwest are facing a second major storm in as many months, with some flooded towns now waiting for as much as 20 inches of snow on top of a muddy mess left from the previous storm.

title: Ron Wyden's Plan to Drain Investors
summary: A new Democratic idea to grab revenue: Tax unrealized capital gains.. The Democratic competition to bleed the rich has become fierce. If progressives aren't satisfied with Elizabeth Warren's proposed "wealth tax" of 3% a year, AOC's 70% income tax, Bernie Sanders's 77% estate tax, or Rep. John Larson's uncapped payroll-tax increase of 2.4 percentage points, they now have a fifth option. Oregon Senator Ron Wyden wants to tax capital gains as regular income, meaning rates up to 37%. He would also tax unrealized gains, perhaps decades before the investor sells.

title: Australia to Pick Its Next Leader-With an Election
summary: Ruling conservative party seeks fresh mandate, as it is dogged by economic worries and infighting that loom over campaign. CANBERRA-Australia's conservative government said it would hold national elections on May 18, betting on tax cuts and security spending to fend off a strong challenge by center-left Labor opponents as voters worry that the world's longest national growth streak shows signs of sputtering.

title: 'Spying Did Occur'
summary: Barr wants to find out why the FBI eavesdropped on the Trump campaign in 2016..

title: France's Less Than Great Debate
summary: Macron's listening tour will now have to turn to persuasion.. Emmanuel Macron is notorious for his imperious style, and the national listening tour he wrapped up this week proved no different. The Great Debate the French President launched in January to quell large protests against his policies is unlikely to settle much as Mr. Macron scrambles to recover.

title: The Threat of Nuclear War Is Still With Us
summary: The U.S. must re-engage with Russia to ensure the ultimate weapon doesn't spread and is never used.. The U.S., its allies and Russia are caught in a dangerous policy paralysis that could lead-most likely by mistake or miscalculation-to a military confrontation and potentially the use of nuclear weapons for the first time in nearly 74 years. A bold policy shift is needed to support a strategic re-engagement with Russia and walk back from this perilous precipice. Otherwise, our nations may soon be entrenched in a nuclear standoff more precarious, disorienting and economically costly than the Cold War. The most difficult task facing the U.S. is also the most important-to refocus on America's most vital interests even as we respond firmly to Russia's aggressions.

title: College Wouldn't Cost So Much If Students and Faculty Worked Harder
summary: I assign far less reading, demand less writing, and give higher grades than I did two generations ago.. One reason college is so costly and so little real learning occurs is that collegiate resources are vastly underused. Students don't study much, professors teach little, few people read most of the obscure papers the professors write, and even the buildings are empty most of the time.

title: Executive Pay Needs a Transparent Scorecard
summary: Shareholders need to know when CEO comp is tied to disappointing results that have been 'adjusted' upward.. It's proxy season, and shareholders will soon cast votes on executive pay at America's public companies. To vote intelligently, investors need transparency on how pay is tied to performance. Historically, corporate performance has been measured using generally accepted accounting principles-the standard for all statements filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. But pay practices are changing: Executives today are often paid to hit "adjusted," non-GAAP targets. These adjustments can be significant, and their effects on executive pay are poorly understood by shareholders-raising the risk that non-GAAP numbers will be used to justify outsize compensation for disappointing results.

title: Uber to Have Task of Explaining Its Diverse Businesses as It Closes In on IPO
summary: Uber operates in 63 countries compared with Lyft's two, and has a wider range of operations. Uber Technologies Inc. is moving closer to an IPO, but due to its global reach and diverse operations, it faced a greater regulatory burden that put it on a more circuitous route to public markets than smaller rival Lyft Inc.

title: The Lovely but Unloved Electoral College
summary: Abolishing it would import the worst aspects of European politics.. Abolishing the Electoral College is a fashionable campaign pledge for Democrats running for president. Declaring "every vote matters," Sen. Elizabeth Warren says we should "get rid" of it. Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand proclaims American democracy "can't function" until that happens. Sen. Cory Booker, former Rep. Robert Francis O'Rourke and former Housing and Urban Development Secretary Julián Castro support ending it, as do Washington Gov. Jay Inslee ("archaic") and South Bend Mayor Pete Buttigieg ("it's gotta go"). Sen. Bernie Sanders calls the Electoral College "a little bit weird" and wants to "rethink" it, while Sen. Kamala Harris is "open to the discussion," along with Sen. Amy Klobuchar.

title: JetBlue Plans to Start U.S.-London Flights in 2021
summary: The air carrier has yet to secure access to the U.K. capital's congested airports.

title: 'Accidental Presidents' Review: Suddenly In Charge
summary: The two greatest presidents who took office upon the death of their predecessors were Harry Truman and Teddy Roosevelt. Both seized the reins of power decisively and acted boldly.. When President William Henry Harrison died in 1841, barely a month into his White House tenure, some Washington politicians argued that his death didn't confer the actual presidency upon Vice President John Tyler but merely the "Powers and Duties of the said Office," as the Constitution expressed it. The vice president, in this view, would serve as a kind of acting president. John Quincy Adams felt that giving Tyler the presidential title would be "in direct violation both of the grammar and context of the Constitution."

title: Netanyahu's Triumph
summary: Israel's PM wins a fifth term and now faces a Trump peace plan..

title: U.S., China Reach Accord on Trade-Deal Enforcement, Mnuchin Says
summary: Sticking points, such as timing of tariff rollbacks, remain. WASHINGTON-The U.S. and China have agreed on an enforcement mechanism for their potential trade deal, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said, suggesting one of the key stumbling blocks toward an accord had been cleared.

title: Netanyahu Rode Israel's Rightward Shift to Successful Election Result
summary: Israeli leader harnessed voters' existential security fears over threats from adversaries ranging from Iran to Hamas in his bid for a fifth term. TEL AVIV-Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu harnessed Israeli voters' rightward shift on security issues in his successful re-election campaign, a trend that is likely to outlast his rule and shape the country's relations with Palestinians and the U.S.

title: 'Soundtrack of America' Review: Artists of the Future Look to the Past
summary: A concert series attempts to tell the full story of African-American music, stretching back to slavery and through developments in blues, jazz, popular song, modern composition and more. New York

title: 'Reich Richter Pärt' Review: A Most Colorful Collaboration
summary: A multimedia presentation brings together the work of the German painter and Estonian and American composers..

title: Trisha Donnelly: A Tree Falls in Hudson Yards
summary: Trisha Donnelly's installation at the Shed highlights humanity's inhumanity to nature.. New York

title: 'Norma Jeane Baker of Troy' Review: Beauties Made Boring
summary: Anne Carson's verse play compresses the lives of Helen of Troy and Marilyn Monroe into a single narrative.. New York

title: Enemies of the Obama State
summary: Attorney General William Barr says the government spied on the Trump campaign in 2016.. The Attorney General of the United States told a Senate subcommittee today that the federal government spied on a U.S. political campaign in 2016. Now Americans need to know which executive branch officials were responsible for turning Washington's formidable surveillance powers against the party out of power.

title: Boeing Looks to Build Overseas Support for MAX Fix
summary: U.S. regulators form international panel to assess, validate fix for airliner. 'It can't just be the FAA'. Boeing Co. and U.S. aviation regulators will be seeking what amounts to an international stamp of approval around the time they roll out a safety fix for 737 MAX jets, expected this summer.

title: U.S. Dollar Declines as Inflation Slows
summary: Labor Department report on consumer prices solidifies expectations Fed will remain on hold on interest rates. The dollar fell after a report showed consumer prices rose less than expected last month, further solidifying expectations that the Federal Reserve will remain on hold.

title: Global PC Shipments Fell in Latest Quarter
summary: Shortage of Intel computer processors contributed to decline. Personal-computer shipments in the first quarter declined world-wide, driven by a shortage of Intel Corp. computer processors, according to preliminary data from two research firms.

title: Gold Retains Gains after Fed Minutes
summary: Investors buoyed by indications that the Fed doesn't anticipate raising rates for the rest of the year. Gold prices held on to their gains Wednesday, after minutes from the Federal Reserve's most recent monetary-policy meeting showed that officials saw little need to change interest rates this year.

title: PG&E Bankruptcy Judge Urges Deal to End Clash Over Power Contracts
summary: California's largest utility is battling its power suppliers and Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. A bankruptcy judge Wednesday urged PG&E Corp. and renewable energy suppliers to try to reach a deal to avert a jurisdictional clash with federal authorities over up to $42 billion in power-purchase agreements.

title: Johnson Publishing Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Johnson Publishing plans to sell assets following failure to restructure. Johnson Publishing Co., the former owner of Ebony and Jet magazines, has filed for bankruptcy and plans to sell its assets after 77 years in operation.

title: Milan Laser Weighs Sale
summary: Privately held laser hair-removal company engages Lazard to run sales process, say people familiar with the matter. Privately held Milan Laser, a hair-removal service provider in a steadily expanding industry, has retained Lazard Ltd. to explore a sale, said people familiar with the situation.

title: Senate Republicans and Democrats Unveil Health-Care Plans
summary: The dual developments underscore health-care as a pre-eminent policy issue in the 2020 election. WASHINGTON-A group of Senate Republicans is reviving legislation aimed at guaranteeing protections for people with pre-existing conditions, as the GOP attempts to blunt the Democrats' perceived political advantage on health care before the 2020 election.

title: Scientists Release First Image of a Black Hole
summary: The intensely dense hole, 6.5 billion times as massive as the sun, is located at the center of a massive galaxy 55 million light years from Earth. Scientists revealed the first image of a black hole, providing a peek at an object once thought to be unseeable and confirming some of Albert Einstein's longstanding theories about general relativity.

title: Brazil Plans to Charge Vale Over Deadly Dam Collapse
summary: Prosecutor says employees of mining giant were aware of risks at Brumadinho facility before disaster that left around 300 dead; German inspection firm faces possible false-representation claim. BELO HORIZONTE, Brazil-Prosecutors plan to file criminal charges against Vale SA and employees of the mining giant over the deadly collapse of a mine-waste dam in January, the lead investigator told The Wall Street Journal.

title: House Freshmen Grab Attention, but a Sophomore Democrat Is Changing the House Agenda
summary: Rep. Jayapal, co-chair of the influential Congressional Progressive Caucus, helped derail a spending vote this week.

title: A Dying Breed: a 'Cottage' in Bar Harbor, Maine
summary: Amid the hotels and motels stands a throwback to when the likes of the Pulitzers and Vanderbilts built large summer estates. A grand villa on the shores of Maine's Frenchman Bay is a rare throwback to over a century ago, when moneyed visitors like Joseph Pulitzer and George Vanderbilt built lavish summer estates, and wealthy families gathered for summers filled with garden and dinner parties, balls and concerts.

title: Trump Defends Herman Cain for Fed Board
summary: Praise comes after Senate Republicans raise doubts about potential nominee's confirmation. WASHINGTON-President Trump praised his latest pick for the Federal Reserve Board, Herman Cain, a day after Senate Republicans voiced doubts about the prospect of confirming him.

title: Big-Bank Chiefs, Democrats Spar at House Hearing
summary: CEOs quizzed on topics including safety, Russia and gun-industry ties. WASHINGTON-The heads of seven of the largest U.S. banks sparred with House Democrats on Wednesday, arguing the financial system is now much safer than during the last joint testimony a decade ago in the depths of the crisis.

title: JPMorgan, Wells Fargo Results Will Shed Light on Fed Effect
summary: The two big banks kick off earnings season Friday. Earnings season kicks off in earnest Friday with JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Wells Fargo & Co. releasing first-quarter results. That will give investors a first glimpse at how the Federal Reserve's cautious shift on monetary policy affected the biggest U.S. banks at the start of the year.

title: 'Clockwise' by Anna Webber: Putting a Fresh Twist on Music History
summary: Saxophonist, flutist and composer Anna Webber creates music with compelling, intense new rhythms that were inspired by great 20th-century classical composers..

title: U.S. Pressures Russia-Linked Firm to Sell Stake in Cybersecurity Company
summary: National security officials tell private-equity firm with ties to billionaire Mikhail Fridman to sell interest in Cofense. U.S. national security officials told a private-equity firm partly backed by a Russian billionaire named in the Steele dossier to sell its stake in Cofense Inc., a cybersecurity firm used by major corporations, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: U.S. Inflation Stayed Tame in March
summary: Energy prices increased 3.5%, helping push up overall inflation. U.S. consumer prices rose more than usual in March, driven by an increase in volatile oil prices that masked moderate underlying price pressures.

title: Elaine Chao Defends Timing of FAA Decision to Ground Boeing Jet
summary: Transportation secretary says aviation agency acted carefully in waiting until three days after crash to halt flights. U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao on Wednesday defended the Federal Aviation Administration's decision to wait three days before grounding Boeing Co. 's 737 MAX planes after the fatal crash of one of the jetliners in Ethiopia last month.

title: U.S. Treasury Yields Under Pressure Following CPI, Fed Minutes
summary: Yields slipped after data suggested inflationary pressures remain contained. U.S. government bond yields fell Wednesday following an underwhelming report on consumer prices and cautious signals from central-bank officials.

title: Venezuelans Who Fled Crisis Fear They May Never Be Able to Return
summary: Those who fled South America's worst humanitarian crisis are losing hope as President Maduro clings to power and conditions worsen at home; 'I'm resigned to stay where we are'. LIMA, Peru-Oscar Villarroel confidently told his customers at a barbershop here in recent months that the Venezuelan regime would soon fall and he could be heading home.

title: U.S. Stocks End Day Higher as Investors Weigh Inflation, Fed Minutes
summary: Latest release shows Fed officials' conviction that they wouldn't need to change interest rates this year. U.S. stocks edged higher Wednesday, steadying following Tuesday's decline as investors weighed data showing moderate inflation and the latest signs of caution from global central banks.

title: Puerto Rico Utility Nears Deal on $9 Billion Restructuring
summary: Bond guarantor Assured Guaranty joins bondholders in debt settlement proposal. Puerto Rico's bankrupt power authority moved closer to a creditor settlement that would ease its potential privatization, agreeing to restructuring terms with a bond guarantor and seeking to postpone further litigation.

title: Oil Edges Higher as Venezuela Output Collapses
summary: Prices climb as production dips in struggling South American nation, fellow OPEC member Saudi Arabia. • Oil prices rose to their highest in more than five months Wednesday as a sharp decline in Venezuelan oil production more than offset the effect of a weekly report showing another increase in U.S. inventories of crude oil.

title: Carbon-Free Nuclear Power Faces Obstacles
summary: Old nuclear plants aren't being retired and replaced by newer, safer plants. Instead, their operations are being stretched beyond design limits.. Regarding James Hansen and Michael Shellenberger's "The Climate Needs Nuclear Power" (op-ed, April 5): Nuclear plants are designed to operate for only 40 years. As of September, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission has authorized 91 of the 98 currently operating nuclear plants to continue operating for an additional 20 years; or in some cases, 40 years. The NRC has never denied a license extension application. The NRC has also been approving utilities' requests to operate at power levels that are higher than initially licensed. So far, these approvals have collectively added the equivalent of seven new reactors' worth of electrical generation to the power grid.

title: Don't Let the Feds Criminalize Hospice Care
summary: Actually, no one knows how long an individual will live. What doctors do know is what the median survival is for a group of patients similar to the one they are dealing with.. Regarding Kyle Clark and Andrew George's "Medicare's Hospice Rules Could Make Your Doctor a Criminal" (op-ed, March 22): I'm a medical oncologist charged with certifying some of my patients as hospice-eligible. It seems to me the AseraCare case is based on an incorrect premise that a physician can tell how long an individual patient will live.

title: Shrinking Middle Class Threatens Global Growth, Stability
summary: Recruitment to the middle classes is in decline across developed countries, says the OECD. The middle class is shrinking and its economic power diminishing in the U.S. and other rich countries, a development that threatens political stability and economic growth, according to a report by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: Brooklyn Prosecutors Charge Three With Trafficking Guns From South Carolina
summary: Authorities continue to target 'Iron Pipeline' that moves weapons to New York from states with looser gun laws.. The Brooklyn district attorney's office said it had charged three men with trafficking guns from South Carolina to New York City, part of an effort by law enforcement to crack down on weapons purchased legally in southern states.

title: Philosophy Courses Score Low on Diversity Exams
summary: I asked by a show of hands, how many answered true? Lots of hands went up. How many of you answered false? Again, many hands went up. Then I asked, how many of you got the answer marked wrong? No hands went up.. Regarding the letters of April 5: "Villanova: What Would St. Augustine Say?": I taught philosophy at Butler University in Indianapolis for 22 years. Philosophy courses will score low on diversity evaluations. When "gay marriage" was discussed in my ethics class, gays and progressives thought the class was intolerant. At the same time, conservative students thought that treating the matter as an open question was ridiculous.

title: Betomania May Not Survive Much Closer Voter Scrutiny
summary: Ted Rall is right to suggest that Beto O'Rourke gives the appearance of vacuity, of studied vagueness.. Ted Rall is right to suggest that Beto O'Rourke gives the appearance of vacuity, of studied vagueness ("Will Betomania Sweep America?" op-ed, April 2). But actually Mr. O'Rourke's vagueness should be seen as disingenuous. He actually does stand for something, but it involves the politics of the center-right.

title: Reparations and Star Trek
summary: Before the debate on reparations tears the country further apart, perhaps one way to address this slippery and irrational idea is for the U.S. to borrow and enact a mandate mentioned in the Star Trek 1987 episode "Encounter at Farpoint.". Regarding "Reparations for Slavery Open Pandora's Box" (Letters, April 1): Before the debate on reparations tears the country further apart, perhaps one way to address this slippery and irrational idea is for the U.S. to borrow and enact a mandate mentioned in the Star Trek 1987 episode "Encounter at Farpoint," to paraphrase: "In the year 2036 the 'New United Nations' declared that no Earth citizen could be made to answer for the crimes of his race or forebears."

title: Familiarity May Breed Contempt for Snapchat's Users
summary: eMarketer projects Snapchat will incur annual user losses for the first time in 2019. Snapchat has a lot of young users. Maybe too many.

title: Court Deals Another Blow to Marble Ridge in Neiman Fight
summary: Judge allows countersuit by luxury department store operator to move forward. Debt activist Marble Ridge Capital LP suffered another setback in its litigation against Neiman Marcus Group when a judge allowed a countersuit by the luxury department store operator to go forward.

title: Expanded Diversity Initiative at NYC's Elite Schools Yields Few Gains
summary: Data likely to fuel argument against the specialized high-school admissions test. Mayor Bill de Blasio's effort to better integrate New York City's elite specialized high schools next fall by admitting more students who miss the test-score cutoff for entry made only small gains in adding black and Hispanic students, data released Wednesday showed.

title: Scottsdale Reaching for the Sky
summary: Newcomers to this desert town seek a more urban living experience than the area has ever provided before. Developers here are responding by building up, not out.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Global Positioning Helps Israeli Leader in Election and Beyond
summary: Courting foreign powers, Israeli prime minister gained favors and votes. TEL AVIV-As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivered his victory speech Wednesday morning in Tel Aviv, he stood under a giant screen that flashed images of world leaders whose embrace contributed to his re-election.

title: Fed Minutes: Little Need Seen to Change Interest Rates This Year
summary: FOMC members cited greater risks from global slowdown, muted inflation readings in keeping rates steady. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve officials signaled greater conviction at their meeting last month that they don't need to move interest rates up or down.

title: U.S. Budget Deficit Grew 15% in First Half of Fiscal 2019
summary: Government spending increased 5% from October through March as revenues rose 1% over same period. Breaking News:

title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren Reports $6 Million Raised in First Quarter of 2020 Campaign
summary: Massachusetts Democrat lands in middle of the pack of presidential hopefuls. WASHINGTON-Sen. Elizabeth Warren raised $6 million in the first three months of her presidential campaign, the Massachusetts Democrat said Wednesday, placing her in the middle of the pack of candidates who have released their first-quarter fundraising totals.

title: Rifts Emerge Among Sudan's Security Forces, as President Faces More Heat
summary: Four months of escalating protests lead to mass sit-in against longtime leader Omar al-Bashir in capital, threatening a messy political collapse. An uprising against Sudanese leader Omar al-Bashir that started in December has hit a critical phase, as cracks begin to show in the unity of the country's security forces that represent the cornerstone of the president's 30-year-old regime.

title: ECB's Draghi Shows Willingness to Bolster Faltering Eurozone Economy
summary: Central bank president says 'plenty of instruments' available, would review impact of negative rates on banks. FRANKFURT-European Central Bank President Mario Draghi signaled Wednesday that the bank could take fresh action to shore up the eurozone's faltering economy if the outlook darkens, underscoring deepening concerns among policy makers over a slowdown that has dragged on for longer than expected.

title: Delta to Add Capacity Amid Improvement on Overseas Routes
summary: Airline to trim domestic flying growth in the second half of the year. Delta Air Lines Inc. plans to trim domestic flying growth in the second half of the year but will add capacity overall as business on overseas routes to Europe and Asia improves.

title: Brazil to Pay Petrobras $9 Billion in Contract Resolution
summary: Deal would allow Brazil's government to sell production rights in pre-salt offshore fields. SÃO PAULO-State-controlled oil company Petróleo Brasileiro SA will receive $9.06 billion from the Brazilian government as part of a deal that would allow the government to raise billions more from the sale of oil production rights in the country's pre-salt offshore fields.

title: Fossil Evidence of New Human Species Found in Philippines
summary: Teeth, bones unearthed in a limestone cavern part of a previously unknown human species that roamed the island about 50,000 years ago. In a handful of fossilized teeth and bones, scientists say they've found evidence of a previously unknown human species that lived in what is now the Philippines about 50,000 years ago. The discovery deepens the mystery of an era when the world was a melting pot of many different human kinds on the move.

title: Eight Measles Cases Found in New York's Westchester County
summary: Infected children were exposed to disease while attending family events in Rockland County and Brooklyn, where there are two large outbreaks. Westchester County has confirmed eight measles cases, primarily confined to one family whose children were unvaccinated, officials said Wednesday.

title: North Carolina Gas Explosion Kills One, Injures Many
summary: Incident caused by contractor hitting gas line, police say. DURHAM, N.C.-A gas explosion that partially collapsed a North Carolina building and set it ablaze Wednesday morning killed one person and injured more than a dozen others, police said.

title: The Price Is Wrong for Rate Hikes
summary: If the Federal Reserve won't raise rates until inflation heats up, it won't be raising rates for a while. Inflation hasn't been going much of anywhere. As long as that is true, neither will the Federal Reserve's interest-rate policy.

title: Brain-Booster Business Raises Concerns
summary: Supplements that promise to sharpen memory, focus and other brain functions are prompting questions about safety. On most mornings, 29-year old Taylor Dolezal makes a cup of tea and gulps down eight different pills, some from packages labeled Sprint and Rise, that the Los Angeles web engineer believes help him perform better at work.

title: Google Targets CIOs With Its Cloud-Enabled AI Push
summary: The company expects tech chiefs to use its prepackaged services to deploy AI initiatives. Enterprise technology executives are at the center of Google's new strategy to drive business for its cloud-based artificial-intelligence services.

title: No Spring Thaw in Store for Banks
summary: U.S. lenders haven't been this cheap relative to the market in decades, but they may stay cheap if interest-rate and growth trends work against them. Investors have been down on U.S. bank stocks lately. First-quarter earnings from lenders are unlikely to cheer them up.

title: Wanda Jackson, a Rock 'n' Roll Pioneer Who Toured With Elvis, Retires From the Road
summary: The 'Queen of Rockabilly' talks about a career that broke ground for women in country and rock. For more than 60 years, Wanda Jackson has lived out of a suitcase, working as a touring musician and sharing stages with icons from Elvis Presley to Adele.

title: How Dallas the Leadership Horse Glues Teams Back Together
summary: A barnyard workshop, a blown race and one stubborn mutt challenge the old gospel that you've got to show animals-or people-who's top dog. In a hay-strewn pasture outside Philadelphia, a team of 12 undergraduates from the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School has spent the better part of two hours trying to outthink a pair of horses.

title: Disney's Next Big Remake: Itself
summary: To battle Netflix, Disney is launching a new streaming service built around popular franchises, from 'Star Wars' to 'High School Musical'. LOS ANGELES- Walt Disney Co. rose to the top of Hollywood on the strength of its ability to pack movie theaters and theme parks. Now it is betting that to stay on top, it needs to come to you-by streaming entertainment directly to TVs and phones.

title: Sine Waves Show the Power of Perspective
summary: Trigonometry is more than memorizing formulas: It allows us to change the way we see the world. At a recent conference, I was given a sandwich wrap for lunch, and it was cut at an angle to display a bigger cross-section of the filling. When I unrolled it to get rid of some of the bulky tortilla, a beautiful piece of math appeared: The cut edge wasn't a straight line but gently undulated up and down to form a sine wave.

title: Old Wood Can Cost More Than New Lumber. People Want It Anyway.
summary: Fans go to extreme lengths to find weathered beams and boards; 'reclaimed wormy chestnut'. In an orange dumpster one recent Sunday morning, between old bricks and trash bags, Heather Olsen struck gold: rustic wood beams that once held the floor of a 100-year-old house.

title: A Researcher's Hunt for Extraterrestrial Intelligence
summary: Nathalie Cabrol of the SETI Institute, a nonprofit working with NASA and others, on the new tools helping us discover life in the universe. Our first encounter with extraterrestrial life won't be with little green men-it'll likely be with little green microbes, says astrobiologist Nathalie Cabrol. "Microbial life, simple life, is what we're really after in the solar system," she says. "That doesn't mean it's not going to be intelligent in its own way."

title: How LeBron, Magic and the Lakers Failed
summary: Magic Johnson resigned before their final game of the season. But the disaster that was LeBron James's first season in Los Angeles goes back to the first 24 hours after he signed with the Lakers.. There was a fight in the first home game of the season. There were private meetings that quickly leaked into the public. There were insults. There were many injuries. There were even two losses to the New York Knicks.

title: Pilgrimage Sites for Bookworms
summary: From Chicago to Northern Ireland, museums where writers and their works are celebrated-and sometimes sniffed. PAINTINGS, STATUES and significant shards of pottery hold sway in most gallery spaces, but not in a growing number dedicated to poets and writers. Take the American Writers Museum, the first to focus solely on U.S. authors. Occupying the second floor of a Chicago office building, it uses interactive multimedia and even scents to enrich its displays. Push a plaque for Julia Child's "Mastering the Art of French Cooking," in the Surprise Bookshelf exhibit, and the aroma of fresh-baked cookies wafts into the air. The current show, "Bob Dylan: Electric," includes the Fender Stratocaster that the songwriter-whose "poetic expressions" earned him a Nobel Prize-played at the 1965 Newport Folk Festival. Kids are encouraged with Saturday morning Little Squirrels Storytime. americanwritersmuseum.org

title: The No-Money, All-Cash Buyer
summary: Agents recall clients in over their heads. 'Unless it's, "Hey Gwen, it's Brad Pitt," then I don't think so,' says one.

title: Oh, What a Beautiful Chili-a Taste of Dinner Theater at 'Oklahoma!'
summary: Audience members at the Broadway musical revival can chow down on free chili and cornbread. Too bad they don't give Tony Awards for best dish.

title: Ford Shuffles Roles for Two Top Executives
summary: Auto maker splits duties more sharply between its traditional car-making business and mobility services. Ford Motor Co. is shuffling roles for two top executives, splitting duties more sharply between its traditional car-making business and the mobility services the company hopes will drive growth in the future.

title: British Dining Sheds Some Excess Pounds
summary: U.K. restaurants are going out of business in record numbers. Brexit still hasn't happened, but its economic impact is becoming more visible-for example, in a wave of restaurant closures across the U.K.

title: The Surreal Reality of Elisabeth Moss
summary: The star of 'The Handmaid's Tale' and the new film 'Her Smell' has a knack for working in off-kilter fictional worlds that echo everyday life. Elisabeth Moss has just finished with a recent day shooting the third season of "The Handmaid's Tale." She says in a phone interview that her character, known as both June and Offred, didn't spend any of the workday in Gilead, the dystopian nation in which the majority of the first two seasons of the Hulu show took place.

title: Boeing and Its 737 MAX Jets Have a China Problem
summary: A state-owned airline is seeking compensation and that could be just the start of headaches for Boeing when it comes to China. SHANGHAI-One of China's big state-owned airlines joined the list of carriers seeking compensation from Boeing Co. over the grounding of its 737 MAX fleet, a small move that highlights a bigger challenge for the airplane maker: ensuring China, one of its biggest customers, keeps faith with its troubled jet.

title: Petrocurrencies Fall Back in Love with Oil
summary: Some currencies are regaining their link with oil prices, signaling a shift in focus from supply shocks to macroeconomic demand. After years of failing to live up to their name, petrocurrencies are once again moving in lockstep with oil. This may be a sign that commodity traders are shifting their focus from supply surges and shocks back to global macroeconomic conditions.

title: Stocks to Watch: Apple, Levi Strauss, Disney, Macy's, Apple, KushCo, PriceSmart
summary: Resume Subscription. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: It's Up To the Senate Whether the Fed Is Politicized
summary: How the Federal Reserve could become a partisan weapon. For more than a generation, the Federal Reserve has floated above politics, even as partisan conflict has consumed other public institutions. Republican chairmen, including incumbent Jerome Powell, have run the Fed for 28 of the last 32 years, yet you'd struggle to find a trace of monetary favoritism when Republicans occupied the White House.

title: HR Debate: The Best Way to Fire Someone
summary: Employers are trying to be more sensitive in how they handle terminations; Wednesdays or Fridays?. Is there a better and more humane way to fire workers?

title: Metals Trading Firm Arion Adds Energy Veteran to Board
summary: The ex-Credit Suisse trader will advise the London-based firm as it further expands into other commodities. Veteran energy trader and former hedge-fund manager George "Beau" Taylor has joined the board of a London trading firm that is looking to expand further from metals into other commodities.

title: New York Judges, Lawyers Want ICE Officials Out of Courts
summary: Coalition report says immigrants avoid participating in criminal-justice system over fear of being detained. Judges, prosecutors and public defenders are pushing for tighter restrictions on federal immigration officers inside New York courthouses, saying fear of deportation is making immigrants less willing to report crimes and assist with prosecutions.

title: Augusta National Has Quietly Made a $200 Million Land Grab
summary: Resume Subscription. AUGUSTA, Ga.-More than half a century after it opened, the Lakemont Presbyterian Church last year was eyeing a move. But all it had to sell was an outdated building on 1.7 acres bordering a sea of empty lots.

title: Look, Up in the Sky-a Black Hole!
summary: In a distant 'event horizon,' scientists spy a cosmic 'shadow.'. For something no one has ever seen, black holes seem awfully familiar. Astronomers believe they are numerous. Science-fiction authors and film directors love using their ability to warp space and time as a plot device. But humanity is only now getting its first blurry glimpse at a real-life black hole.

title: Billie Eilish Reveals the 11 Items She Can't Live Without
summary: The singer-songwriter, who is breaking chart records with 'When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?,' on the 11 items she swears by, from her favorite drugstore beauty item to the piano she writes her songs on. "I've had Lily, the stuffed rabbit, since I was 3. She and the teddy bear still sleep with me every night. Lily is such a big part of my life. People say she's creepy, but I think she's beautiful. When I was younger, instead of keeping a diary, I talked to her about my life.

title: Hush-Money Probe Gathered Evidence From Trump's Inner Circle
summary: Resume Subscription. The Manhattan U.S. attorney's office has gathered more evidence than previously known in its criminal investigation of hush payments to two women who alleged affairs with Donald Trump, including from members of the president's inner circle.

title: If You Hate Your Internet Provider, Look to Space
summary: Resume Subscription. If you hate your internet provider, the good news is that in the next five to 10 years, you may have the opportunity to ditch it in favor of a system that transcends regional monopolies, requires no visits by the cable guy and follows you wherever you go. That's because just over the horizon there will be constellations of satellites orbiting the Earth at high speed, providing fast satellite internet directly from space. The bad news is that you might just be trading one monopolist for another, since the companies that have embarked on the race to connect you to the internet through satellites include the ones that already comprise much of Big Tech: Facebook , Google and Amazon.

title: Swine Fever in China, Stock Fever at WH Group
summary: A collapse in the Chinese pig population will boost pork prices, but investors in the world's largest pork producer have gotten carried away.. The Year of the Pig-this year, according to Chinese zodiac-is not shaping up well for pigs in China, as the deadly African swine fever has swept across the country. Pork will become more expensive across the world, but a bet on the world's largest producer still looks risky.

title: Turkey Unveils $5 Billion Plan to Help Banks Manage Bad Debts
summary: Measure goes in right direction but may fall short of resolving broader debt issue, say economists. ISTANBUL-Turkey's Finance Minister Berat Albayrak unveiled a $5 billion plan to help the country's banks cope with a rise in corporate defaults, a remedy analysts said may not be enough to erase the towering debt left by a decade of credit-fuelled growth and avert protracted economic recession.

title: Unicorns Bet Big on Amazon's Cloud
summary: Lyft's, Pinterest's and Slack's early commitment to AWS was smart, but it also makes them vulnerable in a way other companies aren't. Lyft , Pinterest and other big tech initial public offerings coming this year are going to be a strong advertisement for Amazon.com 's cloud services. The risk is that they may later turn into cautionary tales.

title: A Chill Descends on the Coal Market
summary: Thermal-coal prices have tumbled to multiyear lows. Thermal-coal prices have tumbled to multiyear lows amid slumping global demand for the commodity, the world's top source of electricity.

title: From Coke to Macy's, Pay for Typical Worker Takes Big Swings
summary: Coca-Cola's median worker made 65% less than a year earlier. The one at Macy's got a 60% raise. Here's why.. As U.S. companies disclose what they pay typical workers, one thing is clear: A lot can change in a year.

title: JetBlue Says March Traffic Climbed 7.9%
summary: Airline company expects a common revenue measurement to fall in first quarter. JetBlue Airways Corp. reported a nearly 8% increase in traffic for March and said it expects revenue-per-available-seat mile to fall by about 3.1% in the company's first quarter.

title: China Stresses Investment, Invokes New Zealand Massacre in Defending Treatment of Muslims
summary: Chinese authorities defend razing of Muslim neighborhoods and accuse critics of 'slanderous fabrication'. BEIJING-Chinese authorities defended the razing of Muslim neighborhoods and the mass use of digital surveillance in the capital of China's Xinjiang region, saying the measures are designed to promote development and security for locals.

title: The Long Bull Market Has Failed to Fix Public Pensions
summary: Sums owed to retirees are accelerating faster than assets on hand to pay those future obligations. Maine's public pension fund earned double-digit returns in six of the past nine years. Yet the Maine Public Employees Retirement System is still $2.9 billion short of what it needs to afford all future benefits to all retirees.

title: Fed Minutes to Shed Light on Growth Risks, Policy Outlook
summary: Minutes should provide color on how officials view the risks to their economic forecast. The Federal Reserve releases the minutes of its March 19-20 meeting on Wednesday at 2 p.m. EDT, providing more detail about officials' discussions where most signaled they didn't expect to raise interest rates this year.

title: Most in Ocasio-Cortez's District Opposed Her on Amazon Deal
summary: First-year congresswoman has 52% favorability even though voters wanted e-commerce giant's jobs. A majority of Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's constituents view her favorably, but disagree with her opposition to Amazon.com Inc.'s former plan to build a new campus in Queens, a poll released Wednesday shows.

title: China's Giant Money-Market Fund Scraps Investment Caps
summary: Tianhong Yu'e Bao is having trouble preventing investors from shifting money into higher-yielding rivals. China's biggest money-market mutual fund is lifting restrictions on how much individuals can invest in it, after suffering through months of outflows to rivals.

title: Netanyahu Holds Edge in Tight Israeli Election
summary: Projections show the Israeli leader edging ahead of rival Benny Gantz and more likely to be able to form a government with political allies. TEL AVIV-Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu appeared set to fend off a strong election challenge by a former army chief, after a hard-fought race that underlined Israel's rightward drift and tested voters' support for a leader facing corruption allegations.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Number of Acting Cabinet Heads Raises Concern on Capitol Hill
summary: Kevin McAleenan's elevation to acting Homeland Security secretary makes him the fifth acting official holding a cabinet-level position; 'It is troubling to not have the continuity'. WASHINGTON-President Trump is filling his cabinet with acting officials, leaving several agencies in limbo about their long-term priorities and prompting concerns from lawmakers in both parties about their accountability to Congress.

title: The Last Twist in the Lakers' Lost Season: Magic Johnson Resigns
summary: The team's president of basketball operations announced that he was stepping down before the final game of LeBron James's disastrous first season with the Lakers. In a stunning move that managed to make LeBron James's first season in Los Angeles more dramatic and more disastrous, Magic Johnson resigned as the Lakers' president of basketball operations on Tuesday night, a sudden decision so unexpected that the legendary NBA player hadn't even told his own boss yet.

title: U.S. Requires Texas Tech Med School to End Use of Race in Admissions Decisions
summary: Agreement is the first time the Trump administration has asked a school to curtail its affirmative-action practices. WASHINGTON-Civil rights officials at the U.S. Education Department are requiring the Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center medical school to cease factoring race into admissions decisions, putting other institutions of higher education on notice that their continued use of affirmative action policies will draw federal scrutiny.

title: Drug Maker Indivior Charged With Organizing Multibillion-Dollar Fraud
summary: U.K. pharmaceutical company accuses Justice Department of pursuing 'self-serving headlines'. Federal prosecutors charged a U.K. pharmaceutical company with organizing a multibillion-dollar fraud to drive up sales of Suboxone Film, an opioid-addiction treatment.

title: State Department Indicator Flags Countries for Kidnapping Risk
summary: 'K' label warns travelers about 35 nations, including Russia, Turkey and the Philippines. WASHINGTON-The State Department will use a new indicator to flag the risk of kidnapping in high-threat countries in an effort to reduce incidents overseas.

title: Attorney General Defends White House Attempt to Dismantle Affordable Care Act
summary: Barr calls Trump administration's decision a 'legally defensible and reasonable legal position'. Attorney General William Barr defended the Trump administration's renewed attempt to dismantle the Affordable Care Act. He hinted, though, that he initially expressed doubts about the Justice Department's recent shift taking a tougher stance against the Obama-era health law.

title: U.S. Aims to Move More Aggressively Against Central American Asylum Seekers
summary: Faced with legal setbacks, resistance on Capitol Hill, White House considers restricting the flow of remittances and to give migrant parents a tough choice. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration laid out ways to move more aggressively against Central Americans seeking asylum in the U.S., including stepping up pressure on Department of Homeland Security officials, amid a fresh setback in the courts and continued resistance on Capitol Hill.

title: Trump Plans to Sign Executive Orders to Expedite Pipelines
summary: Move meant to blunt ability of states and environmental activists to use Clean Water Act in obstructing oil and gas pipeline projects. WASHINGTON-In a move to expedite oil and gas pipeline projects, President Trump plans to sign a pair of executive orders that would overhaul some environmental permitting rules and limit shareholder resolutions aimed at environmental concerns, according to a senior administration official.
